item.title: Econ Club Discussion: Affordable Health Coverage at a Crossroads? | Nov. 19
item.description: Join the Econ Club to learn about and discuss how health care subsidies caused a record-breaking US government shutdown in Sage 3205 at 5pm on 11/19.
item.author: Students

item.title: NYS Taxation & Finance Tabling | Nov. 18
item.description: The New York State Department of Taxation and Finance will be in the RPI Student Union on Tuesday, November 18th from 11:00am – 2:00pm. Stop by to learn more about the career opportunities available, including the Data Analyst position and other potential openings across the department. This is a great opportunity to meet with a representative, ask questions, and gain insight into the department’s career paths, organizational culture, and the important work they do serving New York State.
item.author: Students

item.title: Mercer XLab 2025 Take It, Break It, Make It Contest
item.description: Mercer X Take It, Break It, Make It 2025 edition is here! You (and your collaborators) can take apart and reconstruct, in your own innovative way, anything that helps you learn: electronic hardware, software, theoretical models. Show your creativity and depth of knowledge by reverse-engineering and then making something new! Fill out the 2025 Take It, Break It, Make It participation form by December 20th. Your video submission is due January 12th. Email sawyes@rpi.edu for more details.
item.author: Students

item.title: Volunteer With Unity House of Troy!
item.description: The CCPD invites students to volunteer with Unity House of Troy as they prepare for their annual Thanksgiving Food Drive. This is a great opportunity to give back to our local community, support families in need, and represent RPI. Unity House is seeking volunteers on the following days: Friday, 11/21: 9AM-4PM, Monday, 11/24: 11AM–4PM, and Tuesday, 11/25: 9AM–12PM. Register in Handshake and email Dean Burke (burked5@rpi.edu) to indicate which date(s) and time(s) you are available to volunteer.
item.author: Students

item.title: International Education Week (IEW) | Nov 17—21
item.description: IEW is an annual joint initiative of the U.S. Department of State and the U.S. Department of Education that promotes programs that prepare Americans for a global environment and attract future leaders from abroad to study, learn, and exchange experiences in the United States. It is an opportunity to celebrate and champion the benefits of international education and exchange worldwide. Please join Education Abroad/ISSS and our campus collaborators as we recognize this important week.

item.title: 2025 Annual Electrical & Steam Shutdowns
item.description: The Annual Utility Shutdown for Assessment and Repair will occur Saturday, May 10th - Saturday May 17th, 2025. The central steam plant will be shut down and there will be selective power outages throughout the campus. Review the Steam Shutdown and Electrical Outages spreadsheets for your building. Contact Ms. Lynn Gray, grayl4@rpi.edu with questions or concerns. Work is done on the main Rensselaer campus annually.

item.title: Participants Needed: Immersive Audiovisual Study at CRAIVE-Lab
item.description: Monday, November 10, 2025 12:00 AM - Wed , November 26, 2025 12:00 AM - RPI researchers are recruiting participants (18+ years old, normal hearing) for an immersive study at CRAIVE-Lab. You’ll experience five museum rooms at human scale with spatial audio and then answer a brief questionnaire. Sessions run November 10 — Nov 26; scheduling is flexible. Sign up with Milena Jonas Bem at jonasm@rpi.edu.

item.title: Procurement Services to Present Supplier Showcase on December 4
item.description: All faculty, staff, and students involved in RPI’s procurement process are invited to attend this year’s Supplier Showcase, which will be held from 11:00am to 2:00pm on Thursday, December 4 in the Alumni Sports & Recreation Center. Stop by to network with RPI’s key suppliers and the Procurement team, get your professional head shot taken, win exciting raffle prizes, have some fun in the photo booth, and enjoy a sparkling spread of savory and sweet treats from campus and local shops!

item.title: Thanksgiving Dinner | Nov. 27 (Registration Required)
item.description: Date: Thursday, November 27, 2025 11:30 AM - 2:00 PM - Join us for an unforgettable Thanksgiving Dinner hosted by RecWell at the Mueller Center. This festive gathering promises a feast of turkey and treats, surrounded by the warmth of the RPI community. This event is FREE to all students, faculty and staff. Guests are welcome to accompany anyone with an RPI ID. Please use the link to register.

item.title: Presence, Play, and Collective Dreaming: Embodied Social Practice as Research with Jane Rigler
item.description: This interactive experience explores how engaged social practice can serve as a methodology for collective research and restorative community building. Through facilitated invitation, inspired by the work of Pauline Oliveros (musician, humanitarian, and founder of Deep Listening), participants explore presence and play, cultivating capacity for orientation to what is emerging in this moment. Join at EMPAC Studio Beta from 5-7pm on 11/19.

item.title: MMS Collaboration Software Training Series: RPI Digital Asset Management (DAM) System
item.description: Jim Evans, Director of MultiMedia Services, will present an overview of Rensselaer’s Digital Asset Management (DAM) System on Thursday November 20, from 11am-Noon. This webinar, hosted via webex, will include how to search, download, and manage campus-wide multimedia assets and will include a live demonstration and Q&A. Open to all members of the Rensselaer community. Registration is required: https://rensselaer.webex.com/weblink/register/r83f49d559584c35dc087ba5b15536931

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar - “Shaping a Motivational Workplace”
item.description: People want to use their abilities, connect with others and guide their own efforts. Research has shown that people share these three psychological needs: Competence, Relatedness and Autonomy. In this seminar leaders learn to create an environment that inspires superior performance by helping employees satisfy these basic needs. Contact: Will Fahey 518-276-2318
